page.title: 09Community Hospital
page.content: {Aston}on Deeside in Clwyd is the chosen location for the second purpose built{community hospital}in Clwyd. It will replace a much older hospital in Mancot, built originally as a maternity hospital, because the{Mancot site is too small to be extended to the larger size now needed to serve the area. The site earmarked for the hospital is by{St.Ethelwold's School with access from an extension of Plough Lane. Work should begin in{1987 with Â£3.5m provided by central government. It will have a resident nursing staff, employing about 80 in all and will be run on a rota basis by local GP's. Over 50 beds will be provided for medical cases. There will also be ante and post natal clinics and a day care and rehabilitation centre for the elderly.
